headline.main: INTERESTING FROM EUROPE.; The Victories of Havelock, Outram and Greathed. RENEWAL OF THE CHINA WAR. British Preparations for the Destruction of Canton. The Russian Embassy Refused Admittance to Pekin. NEWS BY THE NORTH STAR. Important from India and China. Successful Commencement of the Launch of the Leviathan.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship North Star, Capt. LEFEDRE, from Havre and Southampton on the 2d instant, arrived at this port on Saturday morning. Her advices have been anticipated by the Canada, at Halifax. We publish below full details of the Indian news, the prominent Items of which were previously received by telegraph, as reported by the Europa.
docs.abstract: Russian Embassy denied access to Pekin

docs.lead_paragraph: THE ALLEGED ILLNESS OF GOV, WALKER,--We are Informed on good authority, that up to a late hour on Sunday night, Governor WALKER was in the enjoyment of perfect health and spirits, and that had he been suddenly attacked with illness, intelligence would have been sent to his intimate friends in this city.

headline.main: LAW INTELLIGENCE.; SUPERIOR COURT MARINE COURT COURT CALENDAR Shepherd Sentenced to be hung. COURT OF SPECIAL SESSIONS.
THE ARMY.; General Scott's Annual Report.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. J. B. Floyd, Secretary of Way: SIR: As the Immediate Commander of the Army, under the President, I have the honor to submit the annual report, on its general condition and wants. Our regiments, horse and foot, including artillery, (serving mostly as infantry) are, as I have remarked in former reports, anything but a pence establishment. ishment.

headline.main: FLORENCE NIGHTINGALE.; it has been frequently stated in the British

docs.lead_paragraph: From Appleton' s World - Noted women. Miss FLORENCE NIGHTINGALE is the youngest daughter and presumptive co-heiress of Mr. Wm. SHORE NIGHTINGALE, of Embley Park, Hampshire, and the Lea Hurst, Derbyshire, in England. As it has been frequently stated in the British public prints, that Miss NIGHTINGALE numbers the same years with the Queen of England,

docs.lead_paragraph: A series of resolutions recommending the reopening of the African Slave Trade, has been introduced into the Texas House, by John Henry Brown, They Conclude as Follows: That our Senators in Congress be instructed and our Representatives requested to urge upon the Congress of the united States the repeal of all laws, and the abrogation of all treaties prohibiting the importation of African slaves into the slaveholding States and Territories of this Union;

headline.main: MASSACHUSETTS.; Municipal Elections--Complete Triumph of the Hunkers in Boston and "Elsewhere" --Opinions on the Douglas Movement -- New-Hampshire--Bank Defalcation--Resumpilon -- Will all the Banks Stand? -- Mr. Slade -- Departure of Mr. Lawrence -- Health of Boston.

docs.lead_paragraph: The municipal elections of Boston, Charles-town, and Roxbury took place yesterday. A finer time for fighting could not have been bespoken, and if gentlemen had chosen to go into it with white pants, they could have done so without any danger from the weather.

docs.lead_paragraph: SMALL-POX.--We learn from inquiries made at the City inspector's office, that a thorough investigation has been made, through the Health Wardens, into the correctness of the rumors concerning the spread of this disease, The reports in almost every case have proved unfounded. The health Warden of the Fourteenth Ward has examined every house

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS....First Session.; SENATE.... HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate adopted a resolution for the appointment of the Standing Committees next Wednesday. Mr. WILSON said that he had been desired by Mr. SUNNER to state that owing to the state of his health he desired to be excused from serving upon any of the Standing Committees.
